mm.net.modeling

Interface NetComponent

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetGearGS108Tv2

    public interface NetComponent
    This Interfaces describes all methods a NetComponent implementation must implement. After implementing you have to add your implemented constructor to the NetComponentFac.

      • getEgressAndUntaggedPorts

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response getEgressAndUntaggedPorts(int vlandId)
        Returns a ResponseObject with the Egress and Untagged ports.

        In the message body a String array is located with the size of 2. Both Strings are equal in length, which is equal to the number of ports located on the device. A 1 at the i-th position in the String signals that the port with number i is an egress port or is untagged, where a 0 shows that the port is not an egress port and is tagged.

        Parameters:
        vlandId -
        Returns:
        an outbound response object with statuscoude(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • getTrunks

      • addPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response addPort(int port,
                                  int vlanId)
        Adds a port as an untagged port to an existing VLAN.

        Therefore all the previous assigned ports are still members of this VLAN. The PVID/native VLAN ID of this port is set to the VLAN ID. So every package coming in on this port are assigned to the given VLAN

        If the VLAN does not exist, it is NOT created, only a 500 status code is returned.

        Parameters:
        port - portnumber
        vlanId - specifes the VLAN to which the port should be added
        Returns:
        a outbound response object

      • addPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response addPort(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> port,
                                  int vlanId)
        Adds a list of ports as an untagged ports to an existing VLAN.

        Therefore all the previous assigned ports are still members of this VLAN. The PVID/native VLAN ID of the ports is set to the VLAN ID. So every package coming in on these ports is assigned to the given VLAN.

        If the VLAN does not exist, it is NOT created, only a 500 status code is returned.

        Parameters:
        port - list of portnumbers
        vlanId - specifes the VLAN to which the ports should be added
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscoude(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • setPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response setPort(int port,
                                  int vlanId,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new VLAN with the given port and name on the vlanId. If the VLAN already exists it is destroyed and the provided configuration is applied. All ports are set as untagged ports. The PVID/Native VLAN ID is set accordingly
        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        name -
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • setPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response setPort(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> port,
                                  int vlanId,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new VLAN with the given list of ports and name on the vlanId. If the VLAN already exists it is destroyed and the provided configuration is applied. All ports are set as untagged ports. The PVID/Native VLAN ID is set accordingly
        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        name -
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • removePort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response removePort(int port,
                                     int vlanId)
        Removes a port from the given VLAN, does not affect the other ports, as they are still remain as members. PVID of this port is changed to 1.
        Parameters:
        port - portnumber to remove
        vlanId - from which VLAN the port should be removed
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscode (200, 500) and a message body

      • removePort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response removePort(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> port,
                                     int vlanId)
        Removes ports from the given VLAN, does not affect the other ports, as they are still remain as members. PVID of the ports is changed to 1.
        Parameters:
        port - list of portnumbers to remove
        vlanId - from which VLAN the ports should be removed
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscode (200, 500) and a message body

      • addTrunkPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response addTrunkPort(int port,
                                       int vlanId)
        Adds a port as trunk port to an existing VLAN.

        Does not change the membership of other ports. The port is (T) tagged and the PVID/native VLAN ID is 1. If the port is already a member of the provided VLAN the configuration is replaced by the provided one.

        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        Returns:
        a outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • addTrunkPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response addTrunkPort(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> port,
                                       int vlanId)
        Adds a list pf ports as trunk port to an existing VLAN.

        Does not change the membership of other ports. The port is (T) tagged and the PVID/native VLAN ID is 1. If a port is already member of the provided VLAN the configuration is replaced by the provided one

        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        Returns:
        an outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • setTrunkPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response setTrunkPort(int port,
                                       int vlanId,
                                       java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new VLAN with the given port as (T) tagged trunk port.

        If the given VLAN ID is not used a new VLAN is created. If the ID is currently used its configuration is replaced by the provided one.

        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        name -
        Returns:
        an outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • setTrunkPort

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response setTrunkPort(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> port,
                                       int vlanId,
                                       java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new VLAN with the given ports as (T) tagged trunk ports.

        If the given VLAN ID is not used a new VLAN is created. If the ID is currently used its configuration is replaced by the provided one.

        Parameters:
        port -
        vlanId -
        name -
        Returns:
        an outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring

      • destroyVlan

        javax.ws.rs.core.Response destroyVlan(int vlanId)
        Destroys a VLAN on this NetComponent. Does NOT change the PVID/Native ID.
        Parameters:
        vlanId - VLAN ID to destroy
        Returns:
        an outbound response object with statuscode(200, 500) and a message body with possible errorstring
